title: BBC East Yorkshire & Humber Live Friday 29 July 2016 - BBC News
summary: fire service says cover at sea threatened by cuts to training .
cleethorpes-born star of neighbours dies aged 92 .
beverley hosts international kite festival this weekend .

documents.title: goodbye : five things we learnt today
text: thanks for being with us today we will be back from 08:00 on monday .
in the meantime let 's look at five things we did n't know when we woke up this morning
author: Louise Wheeler
BBC Local Live

documents.title: grimsby town reiterate calls for a new community stadium to be built
text: grimsby town have reiterated calls for a new community stadium to be built for the club following violence at last weekend 's match at blundell park .
the mariners say a new ground will allow the club to `` design out the problems associated with mindless behaviour '' .
plans to relocate the club have been talked about for a number of years .

prior to submitting a planning application for relocation there will be considerable consultation , whereby everyone can feed in their ideas and concerns , to make sure that the club has considered and taken into account the needs of the area and mitigate the impact on local residents , the general public and fans travelling to and from the new stadium .
author: Louise Wheeler
BBC Local Live

documents.title: family death crash : a18 to close for week-long safety review
text: part of the a18 in north east lincolnshire is to close for one week from monday 8 august for a safety review called for by a coroner following an inquest into the deaths of five people in a crash three years ago

angela cockburn , 49 , her husband david , 48 , his two daughters carley ann , 21 , and bethany , 18 , and bethany 's one-year-old daughter lacie were killed on the a18 in laceby near grimsby in 2013 .
coroner paul kelly instructed north east lincolnshire council and contractors engie to carry out an independent review of the safety of the road .
the council has announced today that a series of inspections will be carried out under full road closures for one week from monday 8 august between 07:30 and 18:00 .
ultimately , the purpose of this work is to prevent such a tragedy occurring again on this stretch of the a18 .
author: Louise Wheeler
BBC Local Live

documents.title: paddling pool closed for anti-slip surface work
text: the paddling pool at west park in hull has today been closed following standard testing of the pool 's surface .
the anti-slip finish on the surface of the pool is not working as it should and therefore a decision was made to close the facility .
the council is working with contractors to resolve the issue and apologises to visitors for the inconvenience .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: new homes on the up in yorkshire
text: the number of new homes being registered in yorkshire is up year-on-year .
more than 2,000 plots were earmarked for building on in the last three months , that 's 400 more than the same period last year .
and for the first time since the early 2000s , the number of detached family-sized homes being registered is higher than the number of flats .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: picture : looking murky in bridlington
text: we are hoping the cloud lifts for sunnier spells later .
one of our weather watcher 's sent us this of bridlington looking murky .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: traffic and travel : buses delayed in hull
text: eyms say the city centre in hull is gridlocked again today , reporting no specific issues causing it , just sheer volume of traffic .
buses are expected to be delayed by up to 30 minutes .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: picture : brigg checkout worker behind healthy eating idea
text: i 've been filming with checkout assistant maria in brigg who came up with the idea to offer free fruit to children in tesco stores .
it has been piloted at some of the supermarkets , but will now be rolled out nation-wide .
the initiative is the latest in tesco 's `` healthy eating push '' after it removed sweets and chocolate from checkouts at all stores in 2014 .
author: Leanne Brown
BBC Look North

documents.title: police eye further arrests following violence at grimsby town match
text: officers are reviewing cctv footage following violence at last weekend 's grimsby town match against sheffield united at blundell park .
six people were arrested on the day , with four of those charged .
humberside police say they are looking to see if they need to make further arrests and issue football banning orders .
on saturday the mariners take on oldham in a pre-season friendly game .
anyone involved in football-related violence will be banned from blundell park , '' humberside police warned .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : will this rain budge over the weekend ?
text: watch keeley 's forecast to find out more
author: Keeley Donovan
BBC Look North

documents.title: mp writes to health bosses concerning a & e pressures
text: local mp graham stuart has written to the chief executive of hull and east yorkshire hospitals nhs trust to build up a of the pressures facing the a & e department at hull royal infirmary .
mr stuart says he 's concerned that proposals to close the minor injuries units in hornsea and withernsea will put the department under even greater strain .
the beverley and holderness mp was responding to an article in today 's hull daily mail , which said as many as 450 people were going to a & e on some days - which was overwhelming its capacity .
author: Louise Wheeler
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : rain expected to clear
text: rain expected to clear later .
cloudy for the rest of the day .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your headlines this afternoon
text: your headlines this afternoon
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: kite festival : skies over beverley set to be filled with colour
text: the skies above beverley racecourse will be filled with spectacular sights during the far horizons international kite weekend .
previous events have featured airborne sea creatures
flying dragons
and more traditional , but no less colourful , shapes

documents.title: business : yorkshire and humber most 'optimistic ' about brexit opportunities
text: confidence among manufacturers has slumped since the uk 's vote to leave the european union , a report indicates .
manufacturers ' average confidence score dropped to 5.24 after the referendum from 6.37 before the vote .
the report from eef , a manufacturing lobby group , and accountancy firm bdo showed .
but , the yorkshire and humber region was the most optimistic about opportunities that the uk 's exit from the eu may present .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: images of pair wanted for £ 20,000 distraction burglary
text: police have released e-fit images of two people they would like to identify after a distraction burglary that took place last month in hull .
a 70-year-old man and his wife were targeted after they were offered urgent repair work .
when the men entered the house they discovered a safe that contained £ 20,000 , passports , bank documents , bond certificates and jewellery .
author: Louise Wheeler
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cyclist seriously injured in hull hit-and run
text: a cyclist has been seriously injured in a hit-and-run incident in hull .
the 52-year-old woman was walking across the stockholm road/sutton road roundabout with her bicycle on wednesday evening when she was struck by the car .
other motorists stopped to help her but the driver of the blue car which hit her failed to stop , humberside poice said .
the woman is being treated for serious injuries at hull royal infirmary .
author: Louise Wheeler
BBC Local Live

documents.title: city of culture : there 's still chance to volunteer
text: you 've got until sunday to sign up to become a volunteer for the start of hull 's city of culture celebrations .
a range of roles are available , including event support and welcome supporters .
organisers say it will be an opportunity to say `` i was there '' as hull prepares for its city of culture celebrations in 2017 .
author: Louise Wheeler
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : supermarket to hand out free fruit to shoppers ' youngsters
text: supermarket shopping with children can be trying .
many parents resort to giving them sweets and other treats to try to keep them happy .
but one store in brigg , north lincolnshire piloted an idea that will now be rolled out across supermarkets nationwide .
tesco will hand out free fruit to parents to give to their youngsters while they shop .
store manager martin jackson explains how the scheme came about

documents.title: cleethorpes actress vivean gray dies aged 92
text: vivean gray , best known for playing the gossipy mrs mangel in australian soap opera neighbours , has died aged 92 .
born jean vivra gray in 1924 , the cleethorpes native moved to australia in 1952 to pursue an acting career .
she went on to appear in shows such as the sullivans and prisoner cell block h , before landing her best-known role as ramsay street 's resident busybody .
author: BBC Entertainment and Arts

documents.title: listen : the 'kite couple ' arrive in east yorkshire ahead of international festival
text: the far horizons international kite weekend starts tomorrow at beverley racecourse as part of the amy johnson festival .
the sky will be filled with spectacular flying displays from around the world , including breathtaking artistic creations and synchronised musical sport kite routines .
there 'll be exhibitions of kites from different countries , and a funfair too .
carl and lizzie have been speaking to leading kite makers ron and baew spaulding from thailand .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: can you help count our whales and dolphins ?
text: scientists are hoping to get more information about whales and dolphins off our coastline .
the sea watch foundation is asking us to look out for the majestic creatures off flamborough head at an organised watch event on sunday .
it 's thought more whales and dolphins are being spotted off our coast due to coastal warming .
author: Louise Wheeler
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire service to look at withdrawing cover at sea
text: the fire service in this region could soon withdraw its cover for fires at sea .
a report by the service 's deputy chief fire officer says it may become unsafe due to a lack of access to suitable training .
humberside fire service provides cover for an area of the north sea stretching from norfolk to scotland .
firefighters are transported to stricken vessels by tug or helicopter .
the service is one of eight around the coast of the uk which currently attend incidents at sea .

`` however , '' says deputy chief fire officer chris blacksell , `` recent restrictions on the provision of suitable training to the firefighters that volunteer to undertake that role mean that it is likely that we will have to stop attending incidents 'at sea ' by august 2016 . ''
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: your views : anger over discarded chewing gum on new multi-million pound paving
text: it 's cost millions of pounds and is supposed to transform hull city centre but already new granite paving that 's been shipped all the way from china is covered in discarded chewing gum .
it 's prompted calls for people in the city to take more pride and care in their surroundings .
you have been contacting bbc look north 's facebook page about this story .
we need more cctv in hull , that way you can fine them for doing this .
it 's wrong , put gum in the bin and fine them £ 100 , that will teach them a lesson .
you can change the pavement but sadly ca n't change some people , disgusting habit .
it 's slobbish , selfish and disgusting !
i have never dropped litter or chewing gum in my life !
i dispose of my litter in a public bin - even if it means i do have to walk a little further out of my way .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: the top stories around the region this morning include :
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: challenge cup : wigan warriors v hull fc
text: hull fc will be looking to beat wigan for a place in this season 's challenge cup final .
the black and whites face their lancashire rivals at doncaster 's keepmoat stadium .
they will be taking more than 7,000 fans with them .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: sport : campbell weigh-in expected later
text: hull boxer luke campbell weighs in for his lightweight fight with former world champion argenis mendez in leeds later today .
the bill also sees tommy coyle chasing a british title against fellow yorkshireman tyrone nurse .
four years ago campbell was preparing for his assault on the olympic gold medal and says he 's improved since then .

documents.title: weather : what 's in store for the weekend ?
text: watch my full forecast here
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning and welcome to local live on friday 29 july .
my name 's louise and i 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates from across the area until 18:00 .
please get in touch and let us know what 's happening where you are , by email , facebook or twitter .
remember to send us your weather throughout the day .
below is beverley earlier this morning .
author: Louise Wheeler
BBC Local Live
